item.title: Implementing value speculation in OCaml
item.description: Value speculation exploits the CPU branch predictor to improve instruction parallelism. Here is an example of it in OCaml.

item.title: Work in progress status and links
item.description: This article holds my Github projects links related to Mirage-OCaml-ESP32 and will be updated with my progress. It also serve as my notepad and thought long-term storage so you might expect random stuff there too!

item.title: What now?
item.description: My OCaml Labs internship is done, and my ESP32 work has been presented at ICFP 2018's OCaml Workshop. So what's next ?

item.title: Build your own Mirage application!
item.description: A month after the first proof of concept, work has been done and here is how you can start to experiment with Mirage on ESP32 chips.

item.title: A Mirage unikernel running on an ESP32
item.description: I finally hacked my way into running a first Mirage hello world!

item.title: Compiling and linking for ESP32
item.description: A guide to a full native compilation workflow for ESP32

item.title: The Xtensa architecture
item.description: Let's have an insight on what kind of processor ESP32 boards rely on. A lot of standard stuff but my attention will be drawn on something called "windowed registers"

item.title: Last week report
item.description: Assembly, code generation and debugging fun!

item.title: Mirage on embedded devices: where are we?
item.description: As an intern at the OCamlLab, my project is to port MirageOS on ESP32 boards. This is my first post to explain a bit what is the subject, give some links, hints on what is to be done.
